newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar nears resistance but volume thin.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar nears resistance but volume thin.

text.p: White sugar futures pushed higher in a light Tuesday session on the back of spot March premium buying and covering of short positions, traders said.
"There is some decent party/party trading but people are doing what they have to do and nothing else. There's nothing really outrageous and the volume is quite light," said one.
Arbitrage buyers were drawn into March as the strength of the nearby raws contract caused the premium to narrow.
The scant volume, which totalled 730 lots by 1646 GMT, was boosted by commission house crossed trades. March was up $2.00 at $303.40, with sell-stops in place above $304.00 to cap gains.
May was up $2.10 at $303.00 and other traded positions were also firmer.
Technically, March is nudging towards its 40-day average at $304.00, which also acted as a nearby resistance point when it stood at $304.50 in Friday's session.

Physical brokers said the results of Iraq's tender to buy sugar under the U.N. oil-for-food deal would be slow to emerge as the financing arrangements would demand scrutiny from various parties and the tender restrictions were numerous.
Paris futures also gained ground although only the two nearbys were traded in an overall volume of 385 lots.
March was up $1.20 at $303.30 and May up $1.00 at $303.00.
